choices: Apply for a part-time job at the local research facility.
Get some rest—today's not the day for an adventure.
1.content:
With a sigh, you look again at your watch.

"Four o'clock already?" you mutter. "There's no way I'll be able to get everything done today."

It's true. You had told yourself you were going to be productive today, but here it is mid-afternoon and your only accomplishment so far has been the purchase and consumption of an over-priced slice of pizza from the mall food court. Still, the day isn't quite over—if you hurry, you might yet manage to keep the weekend from being a complete waste. You probably only have enough time to finish one of your planned tasks, but one is better than none, right?

The most responsible course of action would be to finish up your job-hunting. None of the places at the Mall had been accepting applications, but a bulletin board posting had mentioned that some place called "King Applied Research Center" might be willing to pay people to participate in their scientific studies. Even as late as it is, you figure you still have enough time to get over there and apply if you leave right away.

That said, you're not quite sure you're ready to leave just yet—there's a new store here at the mall that looks strangely interesting. You've never really been a big fan of magic tricks, but there's something about this "Spells R Us" store that just seems to call to you. You tell yourself you should just come back later when you're not so busy, but somehow you can't shake the feeling that you might not get another chance. It couldn't hurt to check it out, could it? At the very least you might find some cool posters or something.

Then again, your best friends Kyle and Matthew were planning on exploring that old abandoned mansion at the edge of town today. You'd told them you couldn't go because you'd be too busy job-hunting, but after today's unrelenting series of failures you could really use a break. They should be leaving about this time—if you call now, they could probably swing by and pick you up on their way over.

Glancing again at your watch, you realize it's now four-fifteen. Whatever you decide to do, you'd better get going soon.
1.title: Opening!

choices: Agree to test the inter-dimensional time-travel program.
Agree to attend the experimental college.
Agree to test the body-swap program.
Agree to submit to a brain scan.
Explore the facility on your own.
11.content:
The Research Center isn't far, and you soon find yourself approaching the tall glass structure at a brisk pace.

As you step through the doors of the King Applied Research Center, you're greeted by a slender young woman who, despite wearing a crisp white lab coat, seems to be a receptionist.

"Welcome to King Applied Research Center!" she says warmly. "My name is Rosa. How can we help enrich your life today?"

"I, uh, heard you guys were looking for participants for some kind of study?"

Rosa smiles.

"That's right! Here at King Applied Research Center we're always working for the betterment of mankind, but this quarter has been exceptionally exciting! As we speak, several of our most groundbreaking long-term projects are nearing completion and entering the testing phase."

As if from nowhere Rosa produces a stack of papers, which she then hands to you.

"By signing these papers you agree that any and all information, trade secrets and unreleased technology within this building are the sole property of King Applied Research Center, and that you will not reveal to anyone, in whole or in part, any details of our projects or your participation therein."

After flipping through the papers to confirm that they were, in fact, a standard nondisclosure agreement, you sign with the provided pen.

"Excellent!" says Rosa with a smile. "Now, as I said, there are several ongoing studies in which your participation would be most valuable. You will, of course, be well compensated for your time. My personal favorite is the IDTS. That's short for Inter-Dimensional Temporal Shifting. In addition to being one of the first to experience the wonders of paradox-free time travel, you'd be paid $2000 for your—"

"The wonder of what now?" you exclaim. "You're pulling my leg, right?"

Rosa smiles warmly.

"That's a common reaction among those new to our research, but I assure you the technology is quite real. However, your skepticism is understandable. For that reason I would like to remind you that you will receive the full $2000 for your participation whether or not the trial proves successful."

"Uh…right," you say. "Still, are there any trials being conducted in this dimension?"

"Oh, most certainly!" says Rosa. "Over in Experimental Neurology they're currently testing an exciting new consciousness transference protocol. While we're not offering quite as much for participation in that study, it's another personal favorite of mine. Compensation in that study falls between $1000 and $1500, depending on the particulars of your trial."

"That sounds interesting," you say, "what's a consciousness transference protocol?"
"To put it in layman's terms, CTP is what you might call 'mind switching' or 'body swapping.' It's quite safe, and sure to be all the rage when it's released to the public in a few years. Once again, you'll be paid whether or not anything actually happens, so please put aside your skepticism."

"Uh… right then," you say. "Is there anything else? Maybe something… less weird?"

Rosa looks disappointed, but only for a second.

"Well, if you really wanted, you could participate in one of our more mundane studies. The Experimental Neurology department is also collecting data for one of their other projects, still in the design phase. All you'd need to do is let us scan an image of your brain for later use in development. It's an entirely passive process, and has no effect on the subject whatsoever. You simply sit down, let us take an image of your brain, and walk out. We can only offer $50 for your participation, though."

You pause to consider your options. Rosa looks at you appraisingly.

"You know," she says. "There's one other program that might be perfect for you. You look about seventeen or eighteen; you're probably looking to participate in these studies as a means to help pay for college, no?"

To be honest, you were more concerned with having a little pocket money for dates and videogames, but the college thing is important too.

"Uh, yeah," you say. "Always preparing for the future, that's me."

Rosa smiles.

"That's good," she says, "because here at King Industries, we're dedicated to the future too. And the future isn't just about fancy gadgets and scientific discoveries; more than anything, it's about the people who are going to live there. That's why, starting this year, we're opening a brand new university to educate the young men and women that will one day inherit our legacy. Our vision is to create an institution that will combine all the personal attention of a small school with the tremendous knowledge and resources of King Applied Research Center. All of which will be provided at no cost to you."

"Wait, what?" you say. "Are you offering me a full-ride scholarship to your new college?"

Rosa smiles.

"That's right; as one of our first students your tuition will be entirely waived, food and board will be provided at no cost and you will receive an additional stipend each semester to cover books, supplies, and entertainment."

"Don't I have to, you know, apply or something first?"

"Not at all. One of the central innovations of the King Model for Higher Education is our comprehensive placement test. No matter what your talents, we're confident we can find a place for you at King University."

While you scramble for a response, the phone rings and Rosa smiles apologetically.

"I have to get that" she says. "Just come tell me when you've made a decision, and we can start the appropriate paperwork."

With that, she leaves to answer the phone, leaving you momentarily unsupervised.
11.title: Visiting King Applied Research Center (KARC)

choices: 1 month. I want to go back quite far, but not too far!
111.content:
"Excellent! Follow this way..."

With that, she leads you down countless corridors, up and down numerous elevators until you finally reach a pair of riveted stell doors. Rosa presses a button on the wall, and the doors slide open to reveal a room, seemingly full of machinery. Here a wire, there a weird tube, and finally in the middle, is a metallic chair.

"Step inside and sit down on the chair."

You slowly step forward... Then when nothing springs out of the wall to get you, you relax. The chair feels cold, and on closer inspection has wires stuck all over. Then, you notice Rosa is still near the door.

"Rosa, what are you doing?

"Oh, don't worry. I just have to operate the machine!"

Uncomfortably, you slump down in the chair. Then, Rosa presses a button labeled "start" and.... It starts. Some kind of touchscreen flies in front of you:
Time travel to:
-30 min ago
-1 month ago
-10 years ago

You shift in your seat. Then you press...
111.title: "I'll take the interdimension time-travel thingy."

choices: You try to sort this out yourself
1111.content:
Your finger freezes as soon as it touches the touchscreen. You suddenly see your finger move back, the touchscreen retract, your body (!) step out of the room backwards. Then, the doors close, following which you realise time is going back. Without you.

-------
At the present
-------
Nothing happened. Elliot just went out cold. Rosa begins to scribble notes on the pad she is carrying:
Experiment failed. Subject is unconcious.
She is about to leave the room and call someone to wake Elliot uo when...

-------
Back to our hero (you)
-------
After about 20 minutes of nothing, you finally see some sign of life. The door opens, again with Rosa, but this time, Penelope steps in, though backwards. Penelope! Of course! She's the kind of girl who would do this. Maybe I could start up a chat with her...

She sits down right where you are, and you take the opportunity to look at her huge boobs up her sweater. But then, you realise something. You are now Penelope.

-------
What did Rosa see?
-------
Suddenly, Elliot sits up.

"Elliot! I thought you had been knocked out!"

"Who? Wha.. I'm Penelope! Not Elliot!"

Penelope. The last test subject. The one who started claiming she was somebody called Elliot...
1111.title: The good bit

1113.content: So you travel back in time 10 years. Where do you wake up?
1113.title: 10 years. Who cares about safety?

choices: "Too far! You're going too far!" is your best guess.
The dizzying sensations fade, as Rosa aborts the experiment.
Darkness engulfs Rosa, surrounding then swallowing her.
You start to feel alien sensations from another body.
11133.content:
You give Rosa a final nod of your head, and hit the icon for 10 years on the display. Instantly you feel dizzy, as though you'll fall. The room spins, and your fingers dig into the arms of the chair. You can't tell up from down, and are terrified about being thrown to the ceiling, to the walls, as the room continues to tumble around you. Pressing yourself deeper into the chair, you curl your legs beneath, and dig your nails in, until they hurt. You refuse to let this damned chair throw you.

You try to call out, to beg Rosa to abort. This can't be normal, you tell yourself. The tumbling sensation continues, as the room looks like it's steady, but every other sense in your body tells you it's spinning.

Rosa sees your distress, reading your face. Easily she navigates, the dizzying turmoil to reach you. You force a weak, "Help me.", but you can't even be sure you even whispered the words. Nausea rises in your throat, and fighting not to puke, you swallow reflexively. You don't want to puke over Rosa, you don't want to piss off your rescuer.

Ridding yourself of the conflict, you close your eyes to the untrustworthy steady room. Focusing instead on controlling your stomach against the spinning sensation. Eyes screwed tight shut, you feel yourself sink into and through the chair. Rather as if you're being pulled from your body. Ripped out, you dig your nails in deeper, but it still feels as if you're slipping from your body instead of the seat. Thoughts become strained, and instinct rules you, as your concentration flees.

One eye is pried back open, and Rosa looms in front of one eye. She's saying something, but you can't hear what. A deafening silence steals away her words. You try to read her lips, her expression to work out what she's saying.
11133.title: Rosa starts the process.

choices: You see other young women dressed like yourself.
You want to... need to check the date, ensure it's not a prank.
"Barbi! Pay attention!" A stern female voice barks ... towards you?!
111331.content:
You don't know if you've cried out, but you lose contact with your body, going numb. You feel yourself swept away on some invisible wind, driven deeper and deeper. The surrounding void gives no clues, but you have to assume the past.

At times, you feel a shiver of sensations, as if you've passed through a body. Worry builds, as you imagine these are stops. Points that can accept your consciousness in the past. They're all alien, feeling flashes of being fatter, thinner, male, female, nothing fits just right.

You tumble dreading what'll happen if nothing feels right. As you continue to fall, you try to snatch on. To hold to those sensations, and ... land?... in that body.

Passing time doesn't feel right, but after a few attempts you feel it starting to work. The rush of sensations catches, for a moment, you get a glimpse of the past. It's disorienting, each vision is of a different location, from a different angle, in a different body. You start to despair until you fit!

You land with a thump. More emotional, or intellectual, than physical. But, you blink, and the world does change. The alien body does distort as you take in your destination.

You're in a gym, and a college-aged body. You feel fit and vibrant, and disturbingly female. A swift look down, confirms the weight pulling at your shoulders. The harsh brush of the jacket too strong against your nips... Nipples that are far too large, far too sensitive to accept.

'Summer Ball 1960', the banner announces at the end of the gym.

https://i.pinimg.com/originals/48/48/35/...

You look around wildly, as if expecting to see Rosa. But, as your thoughts catch up you realise it's only yourself that travelled back in time.
111331.title: "Too far! You're going too far!"

choices: Backstage, you hunt for your changing room...
You squeeze past chorus girls, as you feel the walls closing around you.
A stern, terrifying man waits for you, looms over you, he's pissed!
Your eyes dart wildly around looking for something to tell you when you are!

Loud jazz music assaults your ears, and looking around, you see a whole host of people looking at you. It takes you a second to take it all in. You're definitely back in time, from the amount of smokers, and the stench hanging thickly in the air.

A wracking cough, sends your bust jiggling and dancing. Telling you clearly that you're a woman... in the here and now, or the there and then.

As the noise lessens, you realise something else too. It's not just a host that's looking at you. It's an audience. It's your audience! You're on stage.

Looking around wildly for any escape, you look along the plain painted wall, until you see it. Some instinct causes you to wave the feather boa around your neck to them as you go.

https://i.pinimg.com/originals/f3/ab/77/...

Jiggling and swaying you leave the stage, to rapturous applause.

choices: "Another dumb blonde." she sneers, "I'm a red-head, and you're not."
She patiently explains that hair colour defines a womans' status.
"You're a bimbo." she smirks, "Can you even read?" she snorts in amusement.
111335.content:

At times, you feel a shiver of sensations, as if you've passed through a body. Worry builds, as you imagine these are stops. Points that can accept your consciousness in the past. They're all alien, feeling flashes of being fatter, thinner, male, female, nothing fits just right.

You land with a thump. More emotional, or intellectual, than physical. But, you blink, and the world does change. The alien body does distort as you take in your destination.

- - - - -

You can instantly tell, you've not travelled back in time. You'd know women like this existed in the past. Certainly, there'd be pictures. With a gasp, you snatch your head up, ripping your gaze from your own deep cleavage.

Finally arrived, you're glad just to have a body, and sensations that don't flicker and change from moment to moment. Ideally, you'd not be in a woman's body. But, if you're going to be, you rather like how curvaceous it is... Knowing the effect it'll have on men.

Worryingly, you discover a strong leather collar secured around your neck. Your fingers tremble when you discover the padlock holding it in place.

https://i.pinimg.com/originals/49/4a/cf/...

"Turn around girl." A stern voice snaps the command out. The hand landing on your shoulder tells you, that he's talking to you. Also being on your knees, you half-expect a command.

Shuffling around, you wonder if you've landed in some sexist nightmare, where women are possessions. Your bust sloshes as you unevenly hobble around. Already dreading how valuable you'd be, with your insanely busty body. You doubt you'd ever escape.

It's a relief, when you finish turning to find yourself facing a woman. At least her skirt, a sigh of relief spilling from your lips.

That doesn't stop her attaching a leash to your collar. "B... But... I'm a woman too." you fight not to wail the last words in horror.

https://i.pinimg.com/originals/74/df/8d/...
111335.title: A nightmarish arrival.

choices: You desperately try to think of the way back.
Throwing your head back, you cry out "Rosa.... I want back.".
A man enters the room, and all your doubts and questions vanish.
"Mistress...", you start timidly, as a question comes to mind.
1113353.content:
"You're a bimbo." she smirks, "Can you even read?" she snorts in amusement.

"Of course..." you snap back. But she's already smiling, patronisingly accepting your words as transparent lies.

"Then..." she looked around, "Read that." She gestured towards a sign on the wall.

https://66.media.tumblr.com/09c90f4d4a87...

"Well, duh...", but though the letters remain sharp and in focus, their meaning escapes you, the letters individually don't have sounds, let alone together.

"I can't read that..." you answer. Looking around the room, you spot a neon-sign through the window. You manage to count the letters, five, springs to mind. Even that feels uncertain, but again it refuses to make any sense.

"I can't read." the words fall dully from your tongue. Disbelief and denial stopping you from saying more.

"Of course, you can't. You're blonde." She ruffled your mane of hair playfully. Having indulged a willful pet, who now knows her place once more.

https://i.pinimg.com/originals/05/60/6f/...

You look up to her, seeing her as your mistress, as your champion and protector.

Your mouth moves silently, as you struggle to think of what to say.

She just smiles indulgently, and shakes her head, "Those lips aren't for speaking, any more than that head is for thinking."

She sinks to her knees, so you're eye to eye. "Those lips are for pleasing your master."

Her hand darts lower, and you gasp, whimper and moan. As she teases you.

"And those lips are your purpose. You're a breeder. Accept your role, and embrace it."

Softening her expression, "You'll be happier once you know your limits."

Her fingers brush over the surface of your too ripe bust, circling closer to your nipples. She traces damp halos of your juices around each nip. The scent making your nostrils twitch, your stomach flip-flop. Your readiness impossible to deny.

"You'll forget these silly thoughts, once your man is gnawing away on these."

Even now her brief, indifferent touch is scattering your thoughts.
1113353.title: "You're a bimbo." she smirks.

choices: She summons an Adonis of a man to fuck you sensible.
"Rosa... Rosa..." you yell to the ceiling, "I want -like- back..." you bellow.
A man enters the room and you hope to convince him, instead!
11133534.content:
Thoughts feeling like porridge, it's hard to adjust to this new world. You try again. "Mistress..." you start timidly, not wanting to mis-speak, and give her another excuse to ignore you.

"Just 'cos, I can't read fancy words means I'm blonde."

She ruffles your hair, "They're not fancy words. F.I.R.E. E.X.I.T., and H.O.T.E.L., aren't difficult words. They're four and five letters."

She explains patiently, a smug smile on her face, as you frown. Saying each letter slowly, you try to keep up.

"Can you count to five?" she snarls. Sure the question is beyond you. You know numbers, but as you go to prove her wrong, the order swirls inside your head. "Does Three come before two, a hundred is bigger than six... but how much... Where do you start... "The thoughts cascade wildly through your head. Defeated by the question, you close your mouth. Pressing your lips into a cute pout. Before shaking your head 'No'.

"Besides it's this... This!" she says yanking a curl of hair down for you to examine. "This is what marks you as blonde."

The golden curl dances in front of your eyes.

"I'm not ... blonde... and I'm not a woman." you say the words slowly, the memory of your life seems to be fading.

You refuse to go down without a fight.

"I'm not a woman... I'm not!" your voice rising in pitch.

"And these." she snarls. Squeezing and twisting your nipples painfully.

"Do these belong on a man?" She gives your bust a painful smack, once she releases your aching nips.

"I... wasn't.... a... man..." You start. Hands cupping your bust, you protect as much succulent, tender flesh as you can.

"And... I... wasn't.... Blonde!" you nod. Smug that you've won the argument.

"Rosa!" You call out the name, as it comes to you.

She sighs, ignoring your logic as a random rant.

"You'll remember your role, once you experience it again, Rosa."

She shook her head in dismay. "Obviously I can't argue you to accept it. But even you can't deny what a good fucking feels like."

She surrenders her inability to convince you that you're a bimbo. It feels like it should be a success. But her words, her promise of a good fucking sounds worrying. And you still can't count or spell. Those worries niggle at your calm.
11133534.title: "Mistress...", you start timidly.

choices: "A.) I'll do well enough to keep from failing out—…hopefully."
"B.) Is it an oral exam?  I'm better with presentations than written tests."
112.content:
You're a bit taken aback by the offer, but there's just no way you can just turn down the offer of a full-ride scholarship. Thus, you make your way back to Rosa's desk and state your intent. She smiles her corporate smile once more.

"Wonderful!" she says. "I'll start filling out your admission paperwork immediately. In the meantime, just have a seat over there and you can get started on your placement exam."

You blink.

"What, right now? Like, right now, now?"

"Of course," she says, handing you a stack of paper and a pencil. Seeing the look on your face, she smiles reassuringly.

"Oh, don't worry, it's not that kind of exam," she says. "These questions are simply designed to help us see how best to help you integrate into the university community. There are no 'right' or 'wrong' answers; just choose the option that best describes your response to each situation."

Flipping through the packet, you see that she's right—it's more like a personality test than a real exam. More confident now, you turn to the first question:

Question 1: Imagine you walk into class one day, only to have the professor hand you a test for which you have not prepared! You've done all of the reading but this is an important exam and you haven't reviewed at all. How do you score?

"A.) I'll do well enough to keep from failing out—…hopefully."
"B.) Is it an oral exam? I'm better with presentations than written tests."
"C.) I haven't gotten anything lower than an A- since middle school! I'll pass with flying colors."
112.title: Placement Exam: Question 1

choices: "A.) One of the athletic activities, like rock-climbing or windsurfing!"
"B.) Out on the beach, hanging with friends and working on my tan."
"C.) At the club or trying to pick up hotties on the beach."
1121.content:
Turning the page, you move on to the second question.

Question 2: Imagine you're on vacation at an all-inclusive tropical resort. There are a variety of activities available to you, from wind-surfing and rock-climbing to a free bar and nightclub. How do you spend the bulk of your time?

"A.) You could probably find me doing one of the athletic activities—rock-climbing sounds like a blast!"
"B.) What else? I'll be out on the beach, having fun with my friends and working on my tan."
"C.) Those things sound fun, but I'll probably either be at the club or trying to pick up hotties on the beach."
1121.title: Placement Exam: Question 2

choices: "A.) National TV?  I'd want to be the contestant for sure!"
"B.) There is no 'I' in team! I'd prefer to encourage my friend."
11211.content:
Turning the page, you move on to the third question.

Question 3: Imagine you and your friends have been asked to represent your school in the California Invitational Rock-Paper-Scissors Tournament. The whole team has been invited to attend the event, but only one of you can actually compete in the nationally televised Grand Championship match. Given the choice, would you prefer to be the one to compete or provide support and encouragement from the sidelines?

"A.) A chance to compete on National TV? I'd want to be the contestant for sure!"
"B.) I'm happy just to be a part of the team. I'd prefer to encourage one of my friends."
11211.title: Placement Exam: Question 3

112111.content:
“That's it!” says Rosa with a smile as you finish the final question.

“What, really?” you ask, startled. “I thought there would be more questions...”

“Our dynamic placement tests are very efficient,” says Rosa. “Just give me a moment to calculate your score.”

With another smile, Rosa takes your exam and sashays over to her desk, where she begins entering something into her computer. After a few minutes, she comes back, still smiling.

“Congratulations!” she says. “Using our placement algorithm, we've found the perfect place for you! When you wake up, I'm sure you'll agree!”

“What do you mean when I wake—“

Suddenly, you start as a sharp jab pierces the skin of your neck.

“...up?” you finish, voice slurring as you crumple to the floor.

-------------------

When you awake, you find yourself suspended inside a tall glass tube, like something out of a 1950's alien abduction movie. Outside the tube is Rosa, smiling at you through the glass.

“Excellent,” she says happily, “You're awake. Now we can begin the final acclimation process! This is the best part; where you get to choose your new body!”

“My new what!?” You scream. “What the hell are you talking about!? You drugged me!”


“I'm sorry,” she says with a smile. “I'm afraid I can't hear you through the glass. I know you must be excited; just be patient a little longer, this is the last step.”

You continue screaming, to no avail. Rosa simply turns away with a wave and begins fiddling with a computer console.

“Now, down to business. Congratulations; your placement test indicates you'll be of greatest value to the university community as a member of the university athletics program! They're a wonderful bunch; I'm sure you'll have no trouble at all making friends!”

Rose brings up a monitor mounted on a swivel, pulling it in front of your tube.

“Now,” she says with a smile, “It looks like we still have two athlete's profiles still unfilled; either would be a good match for your responses. I'll let you decide which one you'd prefer.”

She brings up two profiles on the monitor, then looks at you, smiling.

Jenny Richter
Age: 18
Hair: Brown
Height: 5'6”
Weight: 114 lbs
Ethnicity: White Non-Hispanic
Measurements: 34C-25-32
Major: Chemistry
Sport: Soccer

Amanda Everett
Age: 18
Hair: Blonde
Height: 5'2”
Weight: 91 lbs
Ethnicity: White Non-Hispanic
Measurements: 30A-24-34
Major: International Relations
Sport: Gymnastics


"Now, just nod toward the one you'd prefer and we can get started."

You try to protest, but Rosa simply smiles.

"No; I can't hear you. Just nod at the profile you prefer."
112111.title: Athlete

You continue screaming, to no avail. Rosa simply turns away with a wave and begins fiddling with a computer console.

“Now, down to business. Congratulations; your placement test indicates you'll be of greatest value to the university community as a member of the school cheerleading squad! That's a very prestigious position; I'm sure you'll have no trouble at all making friends!”

“Now,” she says with a smile, “It looks like we still have two cheerleader profiles still unfilled; either would be a good match for your responses. I'll let you decide which one you'd prefer.”

Trish leads you out of the locker room and down a dark, dimly lit hallway. "This is underneath the fitness center, gymnastics room, wrestling room, swimming pool, basketball court, and inside football stadium," she says, occasionally peeking over her shoulder, eyes inevitably falling on your chest. You have to admit, all of this sounds damn impressive, but the real clincher is: "All in the next three months too."

Outside, the lush, expansive campus takes your breath away. You can't tell what state you're in because the landscape seems to encompass the best of all worlds--literally! Evergreens and forested areas suggest the Midwest, Gothic architecture calls to mind New England, a nice, warm sun and extensive array of beaches bordering large, horizon-reaching lakes (or oceans) take cues from the lower West and East coasts, while some mountains in the distance are pure Colorado / Rocky Mountain affairs. In all your college searching, the small amount you've done, never have you seen anything quite like this. Barring the unpleasant identity shift, this would be the perfect college experience.

Trish shows you the various art and creative centers geared towards writing, painting, sculpting, drawing, acting, dancing, film-making, video game design, et cetera ad infinitum. That's a first. The tour ends at the residential area, which might as well count as a single suburban town.

"Well, I believe that's a good overview of King Applied Research University," Trish announces with a well-rehearsed smile. I grimace at the name. "Yeah, I know, they're still working on an official name. That'll probably come in the next few weeks once some more students trickle in. Now then..."

112112221211.content:
You and Trish arrived at the residential complex. "Fortress, more like," you think, staring up at the twenty-story, U-shaped brick monstrosity. "And all of the students reside in there?" you say out loud.

"That's not including the underground dormitories," Trish says, "which are spread all around campus. You can access those from this building though."

You can tell from the way Trish rattled that off, that she meant to catch you off guard and amaze you. When you shoot her a suspicious glance, she sticks her teeth out in a disarming, sugary smile. "You're sweet," you think, "but sometimes, I can't tell if you're against me or with me." You decide for now that Trish cares for you, at least while you're a new student and she can show you around; but you're not sure if the friendship will survive beyond that.

"Anyway," she says, and the two of you approach the center of the "U" from inside its arms, "the King-and-Queen's Living Quarters are split into two halves for each gender. Girls are on the left. Guys are on the right." She stops and takes you by the shoulder. "And you know which one you live in?"

"The left," you say. "I wish you'd stop acting like I don't know who I am."

Trish flinches at your tone. "I just wanted to make sure," she says. "If you go to the right by mistake, especially the way you're dressed right now..."

You catch her drift. "Right. Ugh!" Goosebumps rattle along your skin, and you feel chilly all over. "I really hope Andrea has some more modest outfits in her dorm room," you whimper. You tug at the halter top, trying to obscure your cleavage as much as is possible. Trish only smiles at the effort. You're relieved to see, at least, that she finds it endearing, rather than another sign of your bimbo nature.

There are countless windows and sliding glass doors all around you, at least fifty per wall on each floor, and that's not including the sides of the building you can't see. Every dormitory on the second floor and above has a balcony; and you see a few students tending to extravagant gardens they've built along the railings. But despite the elegance, which reminds you more of luxury apartments than student housing, you notice that there are only two ways to enter the building. Right at the symmetrical center of the "U", you see two doors next to each other with the generic "male" and "female" figures that you always find on public restrooms.

"That's the entrance?" you scoff. "What do you do if you're transgendered? Is there a place for non-gender students?"

Trish ignores the question. She enters a combination into the keypad on the female door's handle. It cracks open and suddenly you're inside. Your eyes adjust to the mellow brown that colors the entrance lobby. It's modest in size, but still akin to what you'd expect at a decent hotel. Heat radiates from a steel-grated fireplace on the left wall. Chaise lounges and plush arm chairs form a semicircle around it, on top of dim green carpeting. You gawk at the melting-pot array of female students transiting back and forth across the lobby. They represent every ethnic, racial and social group you could possibly think of. How many students are at this university?

"Hi Amy!" Trish waves at one of the students sitting in an armchair. You walk past before you get a good look at her, aside from a thin, pale arm shooting up to wave back. A voice calls out from the other side of the lobby, "Who's the new girl?" in a British accent that briefly excites you, as it might have when you were a guy.

"The best damn cheerleader this school is going to have!" Trish yells back. She looks at you and winks. You don't stop blushing until you're through the double doors on the other side of the lobby.

"I wasn't kidding about the transgender question," you say. The spiraling staircase taking you up each floor (and extending below the ground at least four stories) rises steeply, and if you look up too long, you start to feel dizzy. You focus instead on the nape of Trish's neck.

"You know from experience," she says. "You live in whatever residential area matches your physical sex. End of story."

"Aren't there any non-gendered people?" you try. "Is anybody given a body that's mid-transition or, or an identity that doesn't ascribe to either gender? It's a diverse campus. There's got to be someone."

Trish goes quiet. "There's a lot," she eventually says, "that King Applied Research is still working to implement at the university. You have to remember that this is an experimental institution. We're technically not even open yet for another year... If they like what they see, they'll be accepting applications from the public."

"And will those students have to be different people?" you ask, although you realize right away that it's the wrong question.

Trish stops in her tracks, halfway up the stairs connecting the fourth with the fifth floor. She squeezes the baluster tightly. A tense sigh escapes her teeth.

"Remember what I said," she says, cutting each word short. "We don't talk about our old lives. Or who anyone is. Aside from who we are."

You hold up your hands. "All right! All right!" you say. You flash her a guilty grin, but she's already continuing on her way. You shut your mouth for the rest of the climb. "It looks like we won't even last 'til the end of the tour," you think glumly, watching Trish keep her back turned to you.

At the eighth floor, you go through a door into a tall, spacious corridor with more doors than you can count on both sides. Thankfully, your door is the third on the right. Trish pulls out a key, hands it to you, and with another one unlocks your door. "And here," she says, mustering up a little bit of her old showmanship, "is your room..."

The door opens. Your eyes widen...

Then you shake your head, followed by a big drink. Thinking to yourself, "Stop it. You're still a guy, even if you're in this body, you don't like guys."
Fran grabs your arm and leans in, telling you that they want to move to the dance area and dance. "Come on, it'll be fun and you don't have to do any more than that. Besides, they are both like totally yummy." She giggles. "I'll even let you pick which guy you want to dance with." You realize you kind of owe her for being so helpful and she obviously really wants to be with either one of them.
Reluctantly you sigh. "OK. I'll go but just one dance. I guess I'll dance with...."

112121222.content:
You might not yet understand exactly is going on here, but what you do know is that you want absolutely no part of it. Taking advantage of the congregation in the foyer, you slip quietly out the back door—or, at least, as quietly as you can in four-inch heels. Fortunately, the clatter of high heels must have become such a common sound in the sorority house that the girls simply tune it out, because no one seems to notice your furtive departure.

Bouncing—despite your best efforts—out onto the main avenue through campus, you are momentarily taken aback by the size of the place. As you’d never heard of the college before, you’d expected a small private school, but the campus here apparently had all the trappings of a large university. One building that immediately catches your eye is marked “Administration.” If a solution exists anywhere, that seems like the place to get all this sorted out and the hell off this crazy campus.

Though the walk is short—just across the quad—your new figure is “accidentally” jostled by passing guys no fewer than four times, and countless more stare appreciatively as you stalk past.

Yup, I have got to get back to normal, you mutter.

When you do reach the offices, and are directed to the right area, you’re greeted by the Assistant Dean of Students, a Ms. Lisa Souto.

“And what can I do for you, Miss McLain?” she asks in a friendly, if slightly impatient tone.

“That’s just it!” you say angrily. “I’m not Denise McLain! I’m Elliot, a guy! Not some big-titted sorority slut! You have to turn me back!”

Ms. Souto frowns.

“Every role on the campus provides an essential function to the overall community of the campus,” she says. “Each applicant is placed where they are best suited to contribute to, and benefit from, that community. Our placement test determined that this is the role for which you would be best suited.“

“But she’s a girl!”

“As you can see,” she indicates your body, “That’s not an obstacle for us. Anyone can be assigned any role for which they are best qualified, without prejudice to concerns like sex, age, disability, or other physical status. This is your role. The entire campus, even the staff and professors, are organized this way,. Every role is essential to the proper functioning of this institution, and in your case, the tests were quite clear. You are Denise McLain, newest member of Tau Gamma Sorority—not to mention something of a legend of the locker room variety, if reports are accurate. Now, if you’re certain you’re unhappy with your profile, I may be able to help you make some modifications, but make no mistake: your basic role as Denise McLain is not up for debate. Now, would you like me to help you adjust your profile today?”

1121212221.content:
"Okay," says Ms. Souto. "Now, as I mentioned, there is nothing that can be done to change the fact that you are now Denise McLain, but we can attempt to make adjustments to make Denise McLain more in line with something you are comfortable with. The most amazing part of this is that everything can be controlled. You are currently in the default Denise McLain profile, but I have the authority to modify that profile. We don't like to make adjustments too severe - that's what the placement exam is for - but we can certainly make some modifications. So, Denise, what is it about yourself that you wish to change?"

"I looked through my room," you say. "And...Denise is really, really girly and, to be honest...a slut. And these boobs are kinda heavy and annoying and I'm having trouble walking in these damn heels."

"I see," says Ms. Souto, "but that's a bit much for one modification. What would you say displeases you the most? We can adjust that, and if you are still dissatisfied in a few days, you can come back for possible further adjustment."

"Fine, make it so I'm not a damn slut. That's the worst of it."

"Very well," says Ms. Souto. "Give me a moment to make the adjustment."

You sit and watch as Ms. Souto types on the computer. You shift your purse but do not look through it, and focus your attention on Ms. Souto.

"All done," says Ms. Souto after a minute. "I just need to submit this and you can be on your way. I would encourage you, however, to wait in my office while the changes are processed." You again agree, and Ms. Souto enters the final keystrokes.

Almost immediately upon hitting Enter, you suddenly feel very dizzy, but it quickly passes. "What was that?" you ask.

The new Denise is more studious and academically inclined, rarely parties and never drinks or gets intimate. The changes should be finishing now..."

The first thing you notice is your purse changes, shifting from a fancy-looking designer purse to a simple, functional handbag. But then your clothing begins to change. Your dress becomes less low-cut and more modest, covering your bust and better covering your cleavage. The dress's hemline drops from high above the knee to a bit below it. Your underwear changes as well. Your lacy black bra changes into a simple cotton bra, becoming noticeably more comfortable. A tightness disappears from it, and it no longer squeezes and pushes up your breasts. Your panties, too, change from thin black lace to simple white cotton. Unfortunately, the high heels remain.

Your skin lightens slightly, and you can feel previously-unnoticed piercings vanishing. Your face tickles a bit as makeup disappears from it, leaving you with a natural look. Your hair seems to get a little longer, but you're not quite sure.

"There we go," says Ms. Souto. "Now the system won't allow any more changes for at least 72 hours, so I encourage you to go back to the sorority house and learn about the new you."

You stand up and head for the door. Though you're still having trouble balancing with the heels, walking seems easier, as if an unnoticed ache in your legs is gone. You leave the building and start to head back to the sorority house.

“That's it!” says Rosa with a smile as you finish the final question.

“What, really?” you ask, startled. “I thought there would be more questions...”

“Our dynamic placement tests are very efficient,” says Rosa. “Just give me a moment to calculate your score.”

With another smile, Rosa takes your exam and sashays over to her desk, where she begins entering something into her computer. After a few minutes, she comes back, still smiling.

“Congratulations!” she says. “Using our placement algorithm, we've found the perfect place for you! When you wake up, I'm sure you'll agree!”

“What do you mean when I wake—“

11221112.content:
You skin prickles as you feel the nanites penetrate your skin and go to work. It's a bone deep itch that you can't scratch. It's not painful, just distracting. As you see your clothes turn to dust, and then nothing, it spikes up to degrading. Your hands shift from keeping you in position, to covering your crotch.

Worse, Rosa doesn't seem interested by your nudity. But things take a turn for the worse, as your skin starts to disintegrate. Your bare organs float in the solution, held in place you assume by the same nanites gorging on your flesh. Another glance from Rosa, just as apathetic is another wave of humiliation.

Without eyelids, you can't close your eyes, or even blink. Glancing down, the sight is disturbing. You snatch your gaze back up, focusing on Rosa through the glass. You try not to see the half-reflection of your bare facial muscles. But they move catching your eye, demanding your attention.

The sense of shrinking is hard to define, as you float there. But, your face looks smaller, your body reduced, towards the petite. You don't fancy being small, dismissed as cute. But at least Rin wasn't as busty as the alternative. The idea of adjusting to being Kelsey, to being clearly a girl was terrifying. At least, at a simple A-cup, you could still dress the same, just in smaller sizes.

The tube feels roomier, giving you more space to swim. An instinct to scull your hands, as you float keeping yourself in place. Forcing yourself, you glance downwards once more. You see a reduced chest, narrower shoulders, skinnier arms, ending in slender hands. It's still bare of any pink flesh, those bare muscles red and raw-looking. But thankfully free from pain. The sight is oddly calming. Things are going smoothly.

- - - - -

Rosa looks you over once more. Her gaze dropping quickly back to the console. The expression on her face is easy to read. She's starting to panic. Her hands fly over the controls, as she tries various things. Sparing you a glance, she's only looking to see if her actions are having any impact.

She's making some progress, as you see skin form. Thickening your muscles and veins are hidden beneath a soft olive layer. Not the familiar pink you knew, but inoffensive. It feels oddly tight, but you assume you'll get used to it.

You look to Rosa ready to beam a reassuring smile to her. But that flickers, falters and fails, as you see she's still looking just as agitated, just as distressed. She gives you a curt nod, and stabs a button.

You feel those new eyelids get heavy, and you fall unconscious in the tube.
11221112.title: You feel the nanites work to undo your current ...

112212.content:
“That's it!” says Rosa with a smile as you finish the final question.

“What, really?” you ask, startled. “I thought there would be more questions...”

“Our dynamic placement tests are very efficient,” says Rosa. “Just give me a moment to calculate your score.”

With another smile, Rosa takes your exam and sashays over to her desk, where she begins entering something into her computer. After a few minutes, she comes back, still smiling.

“Congratulations!” she says. “Using our placement algorithm, we've found the perfect place for you! When you wake up, I'm sure you'll agree!”

“What do you mean when I wake—“

Suddenly, you start as a sharp jab pierces the skin of your neck.

“...up?” you finish, voice slurring as you crumple to the floor.

-------------------

When you awake, you find yourself suspended inside a tall glass tube, like something out of a 1950's alien abduction movie. Outside the tube is Rosa, smiling at you through the glass.

“Excellent,” she says happily, “You're awake. Now we can begin the final acclimation process! This is the best part; where you get to choose your new body!”

“My new what!?” You scream. “What the hell are you talking about!? You drugged me!”


“I'm sorry,” she says with a smile. “I'm afraid I can't hear you through the glass. I know you must be excited; just be patient a little longer, this is the last step.”

You continue screaming, to no avail. Rosa simply turns away with a wave and begins fiddling with a computer console.

“Now, down to business. Congratulations; your placement test indicates you'll be of greatest value to the university community as a member of the drama department! They're a wonderful bunch; I'm sure you'll have no trouble at all making friends!”

Rose brings up a monitor mounted on a swivel, pulling it in front of your tube.

“Now,” she says with a smile, “It looks like we still have two acting profiles still unfilled; either would be a good match for your responses. I'll let you decide which one you'd prefer.”

She brings up two profiles on the monitor, then looks at you, smiling.

The next thing you know, the room swoons around you and everything goes black.

"The support PETA rally, of course. You okay, Birch? Did you hurt your head or something?"

"No, no, I'm fine," you lie, and Sara smiles. "That's good to hear. Now, here's your sign." She hands you a sign that says "It's Not Fur, It's Murder!" on it. "I have a feeling the turnout's gonna be really good this year," says Sara, "And that's all thanks to you, Birch!"

You don't know how it was all you, but you smile and say, "It was nothing."

You arrive at what looks like a warehouse, where many people, all looking like college students, are congregated. You see a sign on the warehouse that says "Geraldson Furs".

"We got the perfect day- government inspectors are coming by," says Sara, "They'll be here in an hour and get the message of our protest. FUR IS MURDER!!!" She yells, garnering a deafening rebuttal from the crowd.

"Birch, get up on that rock! You can lead us!" Exclaims Sara. Seeing no way to back out of it, you climb to the top of the rock and look at the crowd of protesters.

1122321.content:
You open your eyes and feel... different, somehow. You feel smaller, and there is a very light, pillowy weight on your chest.

"Oh, you're awake."

You turn your head to see a tall black girl. "I was beginning to think you'd never wake up," she says, "Anyway, I'm Marnie. Your name is Gianna Dunn, and you want to become an elementary school teacher."

"What?" you reply, and realize your voice is much higher and melodic than usual. You get out of the bed you were on and realize you are indeed a girl. You have small breasts and you're very skinny. You have long red hair and you seem to be wearing glasses. For clothes, you are wearing a light pink sundress and a light brown sweater. You see yourself in a mirror. You're a decently pretty, somewhat bland looking girl of about 21. http://dvdbash.files.wordpress.com/2012/...

While you're not the prettiest girl in the world, you could definitely be uglier.

"Take your time to adjust. I remember when I first became Marnie. Oh, a word of advice: we're not allowed to talk about or even mention our past life, that's the old you, there's no going back, so you might as well forget about it.

"So, what now?" you ask.

"Well, I've got classes, and you probably do too," Marnie began, but you cut her off. "No, I mean, that's it? I wake up in the body of this Gianna chick, and I just have to accept it?"

"Gianna, look at me. That's in the past. The best way to get through this is just to look to the future. Now, what's your name?"

-------------------

When you awake, you find yourself suspended inside a tall glass tube, like something out of a 1950's alien abduction movie. Outside the tube is Rosa, smiling at you through the glass.

“Excellent,” she says happily, “You're awake. Now we can begin the final acclimation process! This is the best part; where you get to choose your new body!”

“My new what!?” You scream. “What the hell are you talking about!? You drugged me!”


“I'm sorry,” she says with a smile. “I'm afraid I can't hear you through the glass. I know you must be excited; just be patient a little longer, this is the last step.”

You continue screaming, to no avail. Rosa simply turns away with a wave and begins fiddling with a computer console.

“Now, down to business. Congratulations; your placement test indicates you'll be of greatest value to the university community as a member of the International student program! They're a wonderful bunch; I'm sure you'll have no trouble at all making friends!”

Rose brings up a monitor mounted on a swivel, pulling it in front of your tube.

“Now,” she says with a smile, “It looks like we still have two international profiles still unfilled; either would be a good match for your responses. I'll let you decide which one you'd prefer.”

She brings up two profiles on the monitor, then looks at you, smiling.

1123121.title: Nod to Emelie LeBlanc

11231211.content:
"Bonjour, Emilie," says a voice next to the bed. You turn your head and see a redheaded girl.

"Qui êtes-vous?" you ask, and then stammer in a thickly accented voice, "Who ees you?"

The redheaded laughs. "The name's Morgan. I see you're adjusting to your language barrier. It can be tough for some, but I came from and English-speaking country," she says in an Irish accent.

"What ees zees?" you ask, trying to say 'What is this?', but it comes out in a thick French accent.

"I know it can be tough when you're acclimating," says Morgan, "But soon enough the French accent will seem natural."

"Quit suis-je?" you ask, meaning to say 'Who am I?', but for some reason speaking French just seems more natural and flows better for you. You also notice you're thinking in French.

"Your name is Emilie LeBlanc," says Morgan, "I'm basically, I guess I'm here to help you out with your new life? Something like that. Don't worry, a lot of us are from other countries."

"I am from zee Etats-Unis," you say in your annoying accent, "I am not coming from France." You notice that when you CAN speak English, it comes out broken as well as accented.

"Well, you're Emilie LeBlanc now, and Emilie LeBlanc is from France," says Morgan, "We don't really get to talk about our old lives. This is you now, might as well forget about whoever you used to be. Besides, it's not too bad once you get used to it. Oh, I'm stupid, I'm supposed to show you what you look like."

Morgan gives you a mirror and you can finally see yourself. You have large eyes and a long face, a small mole under your thick lips. You have a long, elegant neck, and you're wearing a beautiful green dress over the curves of your new female body. Your hair is short and dark.

http://iv1.lisimg.com/image/5561417/600f...

"What do you think?" asks Morgan.

"Je suis belle," you say, "I am beautiful."

"I'm glad you think so," says Morgan, "A lot of people don't like their new bodies. Now, I'm supposed to ask you this, what's your name?"
11231211.title: on a bed

choices: "No, I'm Elliot! I'm really a man, I'm not a girl!"
1123122.content:
A moment after you nod at the profile of Aya Nakano, you black out.

When you awake, you're lying on a bed in unfamiliar room. As you sit up, you feel strange. Your body feels different, and there is an unfamiliar weight on your chest. "What happened?" you groan, only to let out an "eep" at the unfamiliar - female - sound of your voice.

"Hey, she's awake!" says another female voice, and several girls move toward you. Looking down at your body, you see a small, but buxom, Asian girl -wearing a modest blue shirt with a gray skirt and a gray sleeveless sweater, somehow managing to cover her large breasts- and realize: somehow you've been turned into Aya Nakano.

As you realize this, the other girls surround you. "Not too close, give her some space," says a girl with chin-length blonde hair, "Remember, it's tough when you're first placed; she needs to get acclimated."

"What do you mean? Where am I?" you ask, your new female voice -and light Japanese accent- sounding odd to you.

"This is King University, international house," says the blonde girl. "My name is Elena. I know, being placed is a shock, isn't it. You're...Aya, right?"
1123122.title: Nod to Aya Nakano

11231221.content:
Elena's expression goes cold. "No," she says, "You're not. Not now. Not anymore. I know it's tough, but we're not allowed to dwell on before. Just accept it and move on. Understand?"

"But I'm not... I can't be a girl!" you protest.

"You'll adapt," says Elena firmly. "You are Aya Nakano, from Japan. If you accept your position everything'll go a lot easier for you and you can more or less do what you want within that position. If you refuse...well, it ends badly. It's a lot better if you just accept it. Do you understand?"
11231221.title: "No, I'm Elliot! I'm really a man, ...

choices: You need some time to yourself. Go to your room.
Explore the campus. Maybe there's a way out?
112312211.content:
You sigh. It seems you have little choice. You take a deep breath and steel yourself. "Yes, I understand," you say, barely keeping calm.

"Good," says Elena cheerfully, and helps you stand, since you're still a little disoriented. You look around and see that the room is large, in soft colors and minimalist decoration. The bed you were laying on is actually a pull-out couch-bed. "This is the entry and common room for the girls' wing of the international dorm," Elena explains. "Here- you should see yourself," she says, and directs you to a mirror.

Though you know you should expect to see a girl in the reflection, you're still unprepared for actually seeing it (even after looking down at yourself earlier). In the mirror is a decently-pretty Asian girl, petite yet buxom, with a shy-looking cute face and straight black hair that reaches halfway down her -your- back. Though your clothing is very modest (the shirt is long-sleeved and shows no cleavage; the skirt is loose and reaches past your knees; you wear sneakers and regular socks instead of heels/stockings; you're not wearing any makeup, jewelry, or cosmetics of any kind), it fails to completely hide your feminine figure or your large and prominent breasts; and you shift uncomfortably, aware of their weight on your chest and the pressure of what must be Aya's bra.

"All your stuff is in your room - except this," Elena adds, handing you a plain white handbag.

From Elena's pointed tone and the deliberate way she gives you the handbag, you get the feeling she wants you to check it, so you do. It contains only a wallet with some cash and ID (you wince seeing the name "Aya Nakano" and the same girl's face on your ID, but suppress it), a plain black smartphone, some basic school supplies (including several pens and pencils and an advanced calculator), and what appears to be a small notebook - labeled on the cover in Japanese kanji (identifying it as your schedule/planner, and labeled with your new name in both English and kanji). And...you can read it and understand the kanji just fine. You're not even translating it in your head, you understand it just as clearly as if it were written in English. You mention this to Elena, and she nods. "Mm-hm, that's the adaptation," she says. "You're from Japan, of course you understand the language."

You sigh. This is all overwhelming, and a lot to take in. You agreed because you didn't see much of a choice, but that doesn’t mean you're happy about it.

"Aya?" says Elena, catching your attention. "I know it can be difficult at first, but it does get better. I can show you to your dorm room if you want. Or if you like, you can explore the campus."
112312211.title: "Yes."

choices: Try to find a way out
11231222.content:
"Good," says Elena. "I'll give you a few minutes. Your stuff is in the trunk by your bed. When you're ready, just call for me and I'll help you meet everyone."

Elena and the others leave, and you are left alone. Going through the trunk, you find various items: several books on varying subjects, basic supplies, and clothes: surprisingly, all are quite modest, in contrast with what you expected. It becomes clear to you that despite her buxom appearance, Aya is far from a mere bimbo or slut.

You still have the question of what to do now? Should you play along and do as Elena said, or run off and try to find a way out of this insanity?
11231222.title: "Yes, I'm Aya"

1123211.content:
Excellent choice!” says Rosa with a smile. “I'm sure you'll be very happy. Now, hold still; this won't hurt a bit.”

----------------

You don't actually remember passing out again, but you must have, because the next thing you know you're opening your eyes again, in another unfamiliar place— you seem to be lying on the cold tile floor of a locker room of some kind. As your eventually vision clears, the first thing you see is a bored-looking elderly grey haired teacher of professor watching you from his desk.

“Finally!” he says with a sigh. “I was beginning to wonder if you'd ever come to any result, miss Goldberg!”

“Who... who are you?” you squeak, head spinning.

“I'm Mr. Hanson, your professor, have you amnesia or something?” he says.
Having a little respect for the professor you say friendly:
“Sorry, Mr. Hanson, you might mix me up with one of your students, I'm... I'm Elliot Barnes,” you stammer, embarrassed by the childish pitch of your own voice.

“Maybe, but you don’t look like an Elliot, miss” he says with a smirk.

Yanking you to your feet, you see that he is right, you look down to see some nylon covered defnetly female legs under a skirt…
Damn it, you excuse yourself and run out of the library you were in and find a full-length mirrors opposite the huge portraits of famous doctors. Staring into the mirror, you can only blink in stunned silence while you must see the reflection of a rather attractive girl…
Staring back at you is a brunette hottie, wearing a plain top and some skirt…
1123211.title: Nod to Samantha Goldberg

choices: Rosa, the woman from the lab
11232112.content:
You stare in amazement at the girl in the mirror. The girl who is now you! What's her name? you vaguely wonder... Then it comes to you... You remember the lab, you remember Rosa, you remember the choices you were given. What was her name? Samantha... Samantha Goldberg... That's her name... well, that's YOUR name now...

You examine the girl standing in the mirror, she's definitely pretty, long brown hair and sweet eyes. She... or rather, you... are wearing a white blouse with a silky patterned black skirt that came a few inches above your knee. Nude pantyhose keeps your legs warm and fortunately you're wearing flats.

After a few minutes, Mr. Hanson comes out with your jacket. "It's a little chilly out here Sam. Are you sure you're alright? You gave me quite a scare when you passed out in there..."

"Thanks," you says as you take the jacket and put it on. "I'll be ok, I think I just need to go home and rest for a bit".

"Ok, I'll see you bright and early for class tomorrow morning," he says while handing you your purse. You take it and say good-bye and start to walk away. You're not even sure where you're going when you hear a girl's voice behind you say "Hey Sam?"

You turn around to see:

It is Rosa and you are kind of happy to see her, while on the other side you are angry about not being informed that you will end up in a different body, in a girl’s body!

Rosa talks to you in the same friendly – sales woman like- voice: “Welcome to your new body and life for a while. I want to invite you for a coffee here in the campus café, while we share some details and so on”

Having no other task right now you follow her. Walking through the cold winter with a skirt its quite different but unique experience for you. Even those nylons are detecting your now pretty legs from the cold it feels like stepping around with bare naked legs….Additionally the whole different feeling of your body is something you will certainly need time to get used to….

While entering the café with Rosa you recognize the glances of the people sitting there, which are mostly guys or men! Of course: They see two attractive ladies entering the café…

As you turn around you see a thin girl with glasses. She has a lovely appearance overall and even she is rather thin she has womanly curves on the right places. This is someone you would like to ask out as Elliot, but you consider your current situation as not able to do the same!

Since she was calling you Sam, which is your name now, she must know you, which does not make things easy for you, because you have no memory or any kind of detail information about this Samantha Goldberg, you became…Your only hope is that you will survive the next time or the time, you are in this body….
“Hi” you answer to her, trying to look friendly.
