1231212.content:
You continue writing:

"Although magical species are common, and many of them have magical abilities, the ability to use and control magic is uncommon outside of intensely magical species like fairies or dragons. Among humans, roughly 20% of people can use magic, and about 10% of those who can are highly capable.

"Witches are female humans focused in utility magic and magic items. Potions and enchanting are their specialty.

"There is one witch who has great skill in her craft, especially for her young age. She is beautiful and alluring, with long, flowing red hair and curves that are perfect but not excessive. Her fair skin shows no blemishes, and she wears no makeup or jewelry - she never needs it."

A few locks of red hair fall in front of your face, and you brush them aside. You feel different, somehow. Your chest feels heavy, and something feels off between your legs. You shift in place, trying to get more comfortable, but the feeling remains. Then you look down - and yelp in surprise.

A pair of firm D-cup breasts stick out of your chest, your waist is thinner, and your hips are wider. Copper-red hair hangs from your head, reaching just past your waist level and touching your seat. You jump up and turn around, examining yourself. But you see only that you are a girl. Still wearing the same clothes as before, but perfectly fitted to your female body. You poke at your crotch, but find only emptiness. Yes, you're a girl.

Your jump in shock as you remember what the old man had said - that the pen only writes truth. But you were writing fiction... You look at your paper and reread what you wrote. Your eyes widen as you realize - you have become the girl you were describing...the witch. Finally, you look up and glance around at the surroundings.

A very pale man dressed in black with a very wide-brimmed hat shrugs and moves away. A centaur woman wearing a dress on her human half glances at you as she passes by. And so on. Many of the people you see are not human, but some sort of fantasy race. In shock, you realize that the pen didn't stop you from writing falsehoods - it made your writing come true.

Just to confirm, you take out your wallet and look at your ID, which still says "Elliot Barnes", though the picture is of the red-haired girl. You pick up then pen and write:

"That witch's name is…" you pause for a moment before a name comes to you. "That witch's name is… Alia Skywind."

The moment you finish writing, the name "Elliot Barnes" on your ID changes to "Alia Skywind". You choke in shock. That confirms it.

12313.content:
As strangely convincing as the creepy old man was, you're not about to trust your performance on a major test or paper to a 'magical' pen purely on faith. You decide you've first got to test this pen and determine which—if any—of the shopkeeper's outlandish claims are true.

Grabbing a napkin from a nearby dispenser, you pull out the pen and, after a moment's hesitation, try writng.

”This is a test.” you write.

Nothing obviously magical happens, but you do note with some satisfaction that the pen writes very smoothly, even on the napkin.

”My name is Eliot.” you continue.

Again, nothing special happens, but then that's true; your name is Eliot. This is it, the moment of (un)truth; it's time to write a falsehood. Taking a deep breath, you press the pen against the napkin and write:

”I am writing in an expensive notebook.”

As soon as you place the final period, you jolt back with a start. With absolutely no fanfare whatsoever, the crumpled napkin before you is replaced by a thick, leather-bound journal inscribed with your initials in gold across the cover.

Stunned you stare at the journal in shock. At first you reason that this must be a trick, a con-game on the part of the old man. But how could he have known what you would write? You hadn't even known until the moment before you did it. No, somehow—impossibly—this thing would seem to be real. 12313112.content:
Eager as you would ordinarily be to test out your new ride, at the moment no mere machine—however extravagant—can delay you from reaching you new 'girlfriend' for one second longer than necessary. Still, there's nothing saying you can't at least enjoy the ride…

Hopping over the wall of your sleek new chariot for the first time—and managing to look only moderately foolish in the process—you slip into the driver's seat and peel out of the parking lot with gusto.

You don't actually know the way to Jessica White's house, but with in-dash GPS navigation, your new vehicle allows you to handle that problem without even using the pen again. Before long, you're pulling up in front of her—enormous—waterfront home, where Jessica stands on the porch, waiting. Waiting for you. Snatching up the precious pen and notebook, you hop out of the care and bound up the steps toward her.

"Hi Jess… uh… babe," you stammer.

Jessica just smiles and gives you a kiss as you reach the door. You kiss her back, enraptured, but after a moment she pulls away, looking troubled.

"Wha… what's wrong?" you ask.

Nervously you glance back at your car. Could the effects of the pen be wearing off?

"It… I don't know," says Jessica quietly. "I just… Listen, Elliot; I think we need to talk."

You gulp, and she looks away as she leads you inside. Casting her eyes about everywhere but into yours, Jessica sits the two of you down on the couch and begins to speak.

"Look, Elliot, you're a good guy and everything. And I hate to do this to you, because I know you're going to think you did something wrong, and you didn't. But… I just don't feel it between us anymore. I… I'm not sure I ever did. "

You just sit there, mouth agape. You just got here, and she's already breaking up with you?

"I'm sorry, Elliot, I really am. I never should have strung you along like this. I… I don't know what I was thinking. I know it sounds cliché, but I hope we can still be friends. You really are a good guy, Elliot… I just don't think I can date you. Keep dating you."

Jessica looks puzzled.

"Weird. I keep doing that. But that's just what I mean, you know? I barely even remember how we started dating in the first place. It just doesn't feel… right."

She shakes her head sadly.

"I'm sorry, Elliot. I… I think you should go."

And that's all she says. She just gets up and walks away, leaving you alone and stunned in her opulent living room.

For your part, you're taking the whole thing rather well, but then again you didn't exactly have much time to get emotionally invested. Mostly you just feel cheated. The pen made her date you, but it didn't bother to make her likeyou? What a ripoff. Well, it's nothing another sentence won't fix. All you have to do is write that she won't break up with you, and she won't! Problem solved.

Then again, that may be an overly simplistic solution. It might be better to address the problem at the root. So she's not really that interested in you; the pen can fix that, too!

While the tomboy thing was cool, your plan had been to have a hot girl as a girlfriend and possible fuckbuddy. Instead, you essentially had girl Vance. And while it was fun to have a girl to play videogames with, your "other" joystick was feeling neglected.

"Hold on, Vanessa. Gotta take a leak."

"Sure thing, dude." she nonchalantly says to you, never taking her focus off the screen as she keeps wasting scrubs.

You go into the bathroom and pull out the notebook and pen. "Let's start small for now. A few minor physical changes and quirks..." You already have three ideas in mind, but before you start, you have an idea. You kinda want to see these happen in the flesh, so you first write down, "Do not enact the following changes on this page until Vanessa is in my sight." then you write down your three edicts:

"1. Lengthen Vanessa's hair down to her waist."
"2. Despite being a tomboy, Vanessa only likes to wear miniskirts."
"3. Increase Vanessa's breasts by one cup size."

Closing the book, you flush the toilet to complete the illusion of having used the john, and return to your room, where angry 12-year olds were bitching at Vanessa over their mics because she was mopping the floor with them.

Vanessa notices your return. "Oh, you're back. Can you believe these scrublords?!"

Then, just an you set up in the notebook with the Historian's Pen, the changes began once you saw her. Her hair inched downed from the nape of her neck, past her shoulders, and as it slowed, you could see her chest plumping from B's to C's. Finally, your eyes deviate down to her legs as you watch her baggy cargo pants ride up, Vanessa wholly ignoring this, as she did with her other changes, as they slid up past her knees, the pants legs going up as far as mid-thigh before fusing together to form a miniskirt, and said skirt shifting further, losing another half a centimeter as it pleated up and acquired a red and black plaid design.

Vanessa notices your staring, and wonders what you're doing. "Yes, girl play videogames gud. Now get back over here and let's get back to it!!"

You shake your head to snap your head out of it. That was... amazing!! Watching Vanessa transform before your eyes!! It was so... sexy. You pick up the controller and resume playing, but your mind is still on what you had seen - the growing hair, the swelling bosom, the pants turning into a miniskirt. Maybe you should try more out on her... but now that you think about it, you sorta like Vanessa like she is now. However, there's still other people in school, in town, and even your own family, and with the pen, they're all your playthings...

After a few more hours of gaming goodness, Vanessa decides to head on home, planting a kiss on you for the good time.

"Now," you ask yourself, "who should I try this out on next?"

12313221211112211.content:
You had found Halestorm, a fast-rising band with a smoking-hot lead singer, through a weekly music/review show on the Internet. As soon as you heard that they were playing in your hometown, you bought tickets for yourself and Vince, who was hooked on them after hearing their biggest song, "Love Bites (And So Do I)"  .

There wasn't much trouble in picking your outfit for the night, since it was a rock show...outside of the underwear, which you were mostly unfamiliar with. You ended up going with a lace-fringed Victoria's Secret set, having just as much trouble with the bra as you expected. Funny, your boobs didn't look that big when you looked in the mirror, but they were a bitch to work with when trying to get the hooks in place (why'd they'd have to make them so small...). Your longer fingernails didn't help much with that either (oh yeah, guess those have to be done too...wait, what? Why would that thought enter your mind?). Black tights, a denim skirt (a bit shorter than you were comfortable with, but the tights helped with that problem), a "Mz. Hyde" top  , and dark blue arm warmers completed the outfit. You did your nails with a black polish, and checked Facebook while you waited for them to dry.

You found your friends list, and saw that you now knew over a thousand people, several times the number that you had cared to keep in touch with as a guy. "Yeesh, how many friends can one person have?" Your own timeline included pictures of you at the beach, on the volleyball court, scoring goals in soccer...the magic had apparently added activities to your life, and made you more important in the ones that you had before.

A little bit of makeup later (slightly disturbing you with your competence with that), you pulled your hair back into a ponytail, and went to your car (now nicer than before...guess you hadn't tried racing that guy once, so your parents got you a better ride).

Vince was waiting for you in line, as you had originally planned. Of course, as this was now a date, he had bought the tickets instead of you. 30 minutes later, the doors still hadn't opened...

"Damn, it's getting cold out here," you say under your breath. Hearing this, he took off his coat and put it on you, which made you warmer than the jacket alone could account for.

The opening act finally showed up, and you went in (he paid for the coat check, of course). They played a forgettable opening, and In This Moment played a much better set to prepare the crowd for the main event (and to sell their newly released album). After a few minutes of intermission, Josh Smith came out and started the opening bass riff for "Hello, It's Mz. Hyde". The band came out one by one to start playing after that, and you found yourself hugging Vince in anticipation. (Pull yourself together, you're a GUY)

Of course you started screaming when Lzzy Hale came out.

They played a few songs, and most of the band went backstage for a break. Lzzy went to the piano to play "Break In"...

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Or-lMf9f7gY

During the crowd's celebration, Vince grabbed you and kissed you. Hard. On the lips. Deeply.

1232.content:
As interesting as a magical pen sounds, you're a typical teenage guy—there was never any doubt that you'd settle on the 'lust powder.' Thus decided, you grab the vial and walk up to the front of the store, where the elderly proprietor is hanging a freshly-painted sign over the counter. After he hammers the last nail into place, he turns to you and smiles, gesturing elaborately at the elegant lettering which reads: 'Because I am a wizard.'

"So," he beams, "what do you think?"

You search frantically for a tactful reply. What to say to a grown man in a bathrobe claiming to be a wizard? You've suspected since you first saw his robe that this guy might be more than a little senile—if not actively insane—but you hardly want to say that, especially if it's true.

"It's… nice," you say.

"I most certainly am not!" huffs the old man.

"You're not nice?" you ask nervously.

"What? No, I'm not senile."

You take a step back. "How did you know—"

With a flourish, the old man points to the still-wet sign.

"Um… right," you say.

"Oh, I know you don't yet believe—that doesn't matter. I only mentioned it because you asked. Well, that and perhaps a little excitement with the new sign—but mostly because you asked. I used to have a rather nice one, you know, with embossed gold lettering and all that. I was really quite fond of it. Quite an unfortunate affair what happened. There were these luchadores, and—ah, well, never mind. It's a rather long story and I'm sure you have places to go. Now, what can I help you with?"

Luchadores? As in masked Mexican wrestlers? Whatever—the man's probably crazy anyway. Better to make your purchase and get out.

"So, uh, how much for this powder?" you ask, nervously producing it.

"Ah!" he says. "Lust Powder! That's a very powerful substance, young man. I trust you read the label?

You nod.

"Then you realize that this powder will make you irresistible to your target? And that it doesn't wear off?"

"Yeah, I guess," you say, blushing. It sounds even sillier out loud.

The old man looks at you appraisingly. Finally, he nods.

"Very well," he says. "You may have the powder for sixteen dollars and seventy-three cents."

Emptying your pocket, you are surprised to find that you have exactly that amount.

"That's weird, how did you know—"

Once again, the old man simply sighs wearily and points to the sign.

"Oh. Right."

Handing him the money, you pocket the vial and walk hurriedly out of the store.

Once back out in the food court, you idly flip the vial over in your hand. Who to use it on? The vial only seemed to contain enough powder for once dose, so you'd have to choose carefully. You could use it here at the mall—there were plenty of girls here you wouldn't mind throwing themselves at you. You didn't really know any of them personally, though—maybe you should take the powder to school and use it on someone there. On the other hand, this wasn't a decision to be taken lightly—whoever you touched with it would apparently be attracted to you for life. Maybe you should wait until a particularly special opportunity comes along.

You've had a crush on her for a couple of months now, and as a result you've purchased coffee a little more frequently than you could really afford. She's a few years older than you—probably in or just finished with college—and her body is the very definition of "out of your league." And yet, if the powder really works, she'll be the one asking you out.

Then again, maybe you should focus on someone your own age. There's an awfully cute girl here in the food court, with a sort of punk-rocker look going on. She's not as drop-dead-gorgeous as the barista, but she's still prettier than anyone you've dated. Besides, judging by the spiked accessories and fishnets, you figure she'd probably be pretty freaky in bed.

Still, as much as you'd like to create a harem of beautiful women, you only have enough powder for one dose. Who to choose?

1232122121.content:
Your mind seems to glaze over at the fact that you've suddenly become a girl and that while you were attracted to punk girls before, now the entire punk scene and it's music seems to excite you. But you're still mostly you, and while reality seems to have shifted so that you have always been a girl, you still pause long enough that you seem like you're hesitating. Jordan's brow furrow for a second before she quickly adds "And what's more, my pleb parents will be away visiting my aunt and uncle this weekend and I'll be alone. We could totally swipe some beer from my dad's fishing shed and get high after!" She bites her lip and gives you a sultry look "And anything we else we might think of doing..."

"Fucking A!" You say excitedly as the thought of not only seeing your favorite punk band at the concert but spending some time with Jordan. Previously you hadn't been into the idea of more than a casual beer and had no interest in weed, but now the entire combination of literal sex, drugs and rock and roll was turning you on. Already you could feel your new female organs churning beneath your skirt. But you were still at school and ignored your new urges before crawling into the seat beside Jordan, who gives you a wide smile and pulls out a package of cigarettes, offering you one, which you naturally take and place in your lips, the deep crimson lipstick holding the cancer stick more than your own mucles. You let it hang there as you lean in towards Jordan as she pulls out her lighter and produces the flame with an audible snap, the small spark leaping onto the cigarette's paper. You pull back, taking a slow drag of the cigarette and blowing it out slowly as if you've done it before while Jordan lights her own. You feel her slender hand slide across yours as you both lean back and stare up at the sky.

Despite the powder having backfired, you strangely felt okay with the strange twist of fate that had befallen you. But at the same time, even with the shifting of reality, you still remembered your old self alongside all the new memories of your female self.

You pulled the cigarette from your mouth and blow a cloud a smoke off to the side as you move a strand of vibrant blue hair out of your eyes.

"Life is strange" You mutter to no one but the sky.

"Tell me about it." Your new girlfriend replies.

As eager as you are to use the powder, you figure you can at least wait until school tomorrow to try it on someone you actually know. Thus decided, you slip the vial into your pocket and head home.

By the time you arrive at school the next day, you're positively giddy with anticipation. Walking through the crowded hallways, you ponder the girl on which to use the powder. The obvious choice would be Jessica White—universally considered the hottest girl in school, the blonde head cheerleader would not only make a fantastic lover but would, in becoming your girlfriend, significantly advance your own social standing. She isn't stuck-up, either; despite her stunning appearance, she is actually very friendly, even to those—like you—outside her own social circle. Her only flaw is that she doesn't exactly sparkle with brilliance. Jessica could provide a lot of things as your girlfriend, but stimulating conversation is definitely not among them.

For that, there's Annie Breen. Annie is something of a geek, and proud of it, but she's also very pretty. Not in the same league as Jessica, but then, who is? Making contact with her will be a little more difficult as you don't share any classes, but you know she'll be at the math club after school. You aren't a member of the club yourself, but you know where they meet—not that it takes a genius to realize that the math club meets in the math lab.

1232211212.content:
Frantically dodging people in the corridor you finally make it to Jessica who is walking alone, still wearing her cheerleading uniform from practice. When in range, you poke her gently on the forearm and then when nothing happens immediately, you give her a harder jab causing her to face you.

"What do you think you a..."

She doesn't finish as the world slows to a standstill with you seemingly trapped in a bubble. Dumb struck you look around at your classmates all frozen in place. You see one of you friends, Matt with his fingers up his nose which causes you to laugh. The laugh that comes out though is more like a girl's high giggle. "What's happening?" You say alarmed in your new girly voice. And then there is a bright flash which forces your eyes closed. Your body is tingling all over, almost feeling like it is moving within itself. The feeling isn't painful but when the tingling moves to your crotch and lower stomach, you feel an inner warmth come over you. Still with your eyes closed, you begin to be able to better distinguish the colours of the flashes but perhaps the most concerning thing you feel is as if you are getting weaker. You attempt to tense your arm but feel minimal response. Suddenly the tingling stops and you start to feel material move across your body. Something constricts your chest but in a supportive way and then you feel flowing softness across your torso and upper thigh. Something clingy works its way up your legs all the way up to your crotch. And then just as fast as it started, the light disappears and all sensations stop.

Its at this you notice that the sound has come back into the world so you quickly open your eyes. The view straight ahead of yourself is obstructed with what appears to be the chest region of a cheerleader. You look up and see Jessica's face looking down at you with curiosity. It's at this you realise your changed perspective. You've shrunk and dramatically too.

"Are you okay?" Jessica says, her voice full of concern.

Not sure how to answer, you stammer. "Um yeah, uh I don't know." With this, you notice the change in your voice again, it is a cutesy singsong voice that you would expect to belong to a girl. You cover your mouth with your hands and your eyes grow wide. "What has happened?" You think.

You remove your hands from your mouth and hold the. front of your face. Gone are the grubby and broad spades of a teenage boy, instead you see tiny and delicate mits with the nails painted a light shade of pink.
You follow the hands up and see hairless and dainty arms with no sign of musculature. You look down to find your view slightly obstructed by two perky mounds emerging from your chest under what looks like a white blouse. Leaning forward slightly, you make contact with your lower body which is partially covered by a short floral skirt with a belt and your slim legs being covered by black tights/pantyhose ending at a pair of small ballet flats on a pair of small feet.

You shake your head in disbelief only to see hair flicking past your periphery. Your hands shoot to your head and are greeted by what feels to be very thick yet smooth hair going all the way down to your mid back. You bring a strand in front of your face to discover it is a glossier shade of your existing brunette hair colour.

It's at this point your eyes grow wide again and you start to reach for your crotch but Jessica, who up to this point has been watching you examine yourself with some curiosity now lightly takes your hand and leads you into the girls bathroom. Too dazed to resist you go along with the now much taller girl.

Luckily the bathroom is empty so more people won't witness your melt down. You both stop in front of the mirrors and you are struck dumb by your reflection. In front of you stands a extremely petite girl 18 year old girl who must be little over 4ft 10. Her face and hair is adorable with, light makeup having been expertly applied and her baby blue eyes wide with confusion. She is wearing a white blouse under a black cardigan, with floral skirt, tights and flats. She is clasping a bag in her left hand which is decorated with flowers and hearts and a sundry of other girly things.

This is you. Your mind races trying to figure how this happened. "The powder will make you irresistible to the one you touch", the old man's voice floats through your head and it hits you. You touched Jessica White so that must mean she likes girls. You don't know what you are shocked at more, your transformation or the fact that head cheerleader and hottest girl in school is a lesbian and prefers cute and petite girls.

"Hey are you alright?" Comes Jessica's soothing voice and a hand touches your shoulder.

You look to her again and realise that the height and size difference between you two is substantial, being 5ft 9, she almost has an entire foot on you.

"Yeah thanks, I just got a little dizzy I guess." You say trying to act natural.

She doesn't look convinced "Are you sure, you seemed pretty out of it? It's like you walked right into me."

"Oh I'm sorry, I was just lost in thought. I'm really sorry for bothering you." You say again trying to end the awkward questions. It seems that your transformation wasn't witnessed by anyone else but you and even then you had your eyes closed.

Jessica's expression softens. "It's okay. No harm done, just as long as you are alright. I'm Jessica by the way. I don't think I've seen you around before."

"I'm Ellio... Ellie" you say almost blowing your cover. "I'm kinda new to the school. This is my first week." Not technically a lie.

"Oh wow that's great where did you come from?"

"Now I'm in trouble" you think so you say the first thing that comes into your head.

"I'm from ......
1232211212.title: A girl your same age.

Maybe that's another feature Jessica imagined her perfect girl to have.

"Wow" she exclaims. "That's amazing, I've always wanted to see London."

"Me too" you think.

"You have come hang out with me. We could go to the mall and I could show you all the best shops or we could go mine and chill. It's the end the of the day so we could go now if you aren't busy." She looks at you eagerly awaiting your answer.

While your mind is still dealing with your transformation and wanting to make your way back to spells our us as soon as possible to see if this can be reversed, a deep part of you wants to go with Jessica. 123222.content:
While Jessica is certainly attractive, you decide that if you're going to get yourself a lover for life you should probably choose someone with whom you wouldn't mind spending time outside the bedroom. Thus decided, you carefully pocket the Lust Powder until the final bell dismisses you and your fellow students to their homes and after school activities. Once the halls have emptied, you make your way down to the math lab, hands shaking with excitement. You wonder idly whether Annie will simply throw herself at you right then and there or if she'll just start fawning over you until you ask her out. Whatever the case, her affections will be more than welcome. As you approach the door to the math lab, you pause briefly, taking a deep breath and carefully sliding the vial from your pocket.

"Here goes noting," you whisper, popping the cork and sprinkling the fine black dust over your skin. It disappears as it makes contact, melting into your arms with a gentle shimmer.

"Cool," you say.

Taking another deep breath, you gently crack open the door to the math lab, only to be met with a terrible realization—Annie isn't here.

"Can I help you?" asks one of the math club members, noticing you in the doorway.

You quickly snap your exposed arm behind your back to avoid accidental contact.

"Uh, is Annie Breen here?" you ask.

"No," says the math clubber. "I think she stayed home sick today, but she should be back tomorrow. Is this about the yearbook? Would you like me to give her a message?"

"Uh, no thanks," you mutter, mind racing. Hastily you back away from the door, letting it slip closed behind you.

This is not good. You've already applied the powder, and as such whoever you touch next is supposedly going to become irresistibly attracted to you. That leaves you with a difficult choice. Of course, you could simply try not to accidentally brush against anyone for the next twenty four hours, until you get another chance at Annie. That could prove quite challenging, though; you might be better off finding a suitable substitute as soon as possible. Most of your peers have already gone home for the day, but you should still be able to find some pretty girl staying late for an after-school activity. It's hardly ideal, but at least that way you wouldn't run quite so much risk of accidentally infatuating the wrong person.

While you probably look a little odd, it will help prevent accidental touching, and may creep people out enough to stay away from you.

The library was divided into two identical halves with a bunch of tables in the center. Most are empty, but as luck would have it, a girl is sitting in the back by the windows. She is cute with shortish black hair tied with two pigtails, a pair of thin framed glasses on her face, and a somewhat small but attractive figure. 1232221122.content:
This girl seems sweet, but you really can't afford to risk anything more happen to you - you have to go and see the wizard as soon as possible.
You feel overwhelmed by nerves - you're still shocked at what has happened to you, and this girl - as cute as she is - was making things worse, being clearly intimidated by someone she'd just met. It was actually quite annoying - you'd like to have a conversation with someone as attractive as the pigtailed girl was, but she's far too shy to have a proper conversation. Is this how all attractive girls feel, you wonder to yourself?
"Listen, I'm going to have to go," you say, noting the sense of rejection that's clear in the girl's face. "But I'll talk to you tomorrow, or whenever I next see you." The look on her face - she clearly doesn't believe you. She thinks you're just making excuses to get away from her. It's a look of embarassment, of rejection - of someone who expects to be rejected, and feels stupid for even trying.
You felt really guilty - you've felt like that once or twice, and it is an awful feeling. At least she was brave enough to come and see you, you think. If your dream girl suddenly appeared to you, would you have the confidence to start talking to her? Could you make yourself push through that fear?
You think, holding your manicured fingers gently in front of you (as there's nowhere else to put them) of what you can do to make her feel better.
"I mean it." You speak more softly than last time, and instinctively rub her arm in reassurance. "I appreciate you coming out to check on me, and I'd love to show you round town."

She smiles as you say this, clearly fighting back the tears. She's a little shorter than you, maybe four or five inches. A bit of your hair has flopped down in front of your eye as you lean in to reassure her. With your other hand, you flick it behind your ear, noting the smell - strawberries, or peaches - something fruity and feminine. It reminds you of what has happened to you, and you feel even more embarassed, blushing even more, and renew your determination to get to Spells R Us.
"I feel s-so embarassed, I'm b-b-being a t-t-total d-drama queen." She could hardly look at you as she spoke, she kept looking shamefully at the floor. "I c-c-came out here to see i-if you're okay, just the w-way you ran out..."
"I'll be okay," you squeeze her arm, softly, and smile as you say it.
You need to come up with some excuse for running out, "I've just gone through some changes in the past few days, and..." you clutch for something, "Right before I ran out, I had some bad news I wasn't expecting."
"A-anything serious?"
"I'll be okay." You smiled as you said it - you hoped it was true.

Taking your hand off the girl, you look yourself up and down - the arm you are pulling back to yourself is long, elegant, with transparent nail polish, you're wearing a medium length black skirt, ending just above the knee, with your legs bare below that. You can feel a slight breeze. Your tanktop is black as well, with quite large breasts (though you weren't used to looking at them from this angle), and your stomach felt tighter, more toned. You're wearing a white belt, though you can only see the sides, your breast obscure the front of your lower body, and you haven't the experience to know how to look round them.
Suddenly you realised you were checking yourself out, and remembered you had to get to the Mall quickly.

"I've got to get going," you say, "But I'll look out for you tomorrow, come over and see me if you see me first." She nodded in agreement. "In fact, I'll tell my brother to keep a look out for you as well, his name's Elliot Barnes."
Hopefully you'll be back to yourself by tomorrow, and while she may not be attracted to you in your male form, she was still cute enough for you to enjoy her company. Besides, being attracted to a girl who didn't feel the same way was hardly anything new, was it?
"I'm A-april. April Sutton." You have to come up with a name of your own...
"Sally. Sally Barnes."
You smile at her, and she smiles back, nervously, shyly, like she can't believe her luck that such a beautiful woman wants to spend time with her. There's a tension between the two of you, you can feel her checking you out, and you're suddenly more aware of your new femininity. You can feel a stronger wind blow across your legs, your heart is beating quickly beneath your breast, your cheeks are blushing, and your lips seem almost to be itching to kiss April. You lick your lips - softer and larger than you are used to - and look at April's. You think how good it would make her feel if you placed your hand on her chin, gently drew her near and gave her a....

You break away, mid-thought.
"I've got to get going." As she nods, you squeeze her, tightly, your breasts just above hers, and feeling bizarre between the two of you. They might even be bigger than Penelope's, you think to yourself, before tearing yourself away.
You run off, to leave before you're tempted to turn back, looking over your shoulder only once, from a distance.
Your hair flops across the whole of your face as you turn.
Her cheeks are redder than a tomato, and she's grinning from ear to ear.
Bizarre as this experience is, you enjoy having a prety girl fancy you - it isn't all bad.
1232221122.title: resist her and run away/something else

choices: Talk your way out of trouble.
12322211221.content:
You briefly consider going back for your backpack, but ultimately decide against it. You need to get back to the mall now; nothing in that backpack is as important as confronting the man who did this to you!

Thus decided, you stomp off toward the mall—and promptly stop stomping, as the violent motion nearly causes your ample breasts to bounce right out of your tank top. After a moment spent collecting yourself, you start out again, this time carefully forcing yourself to adopt a more regulated pace. Even the gentlest stride you can manage isn't enough to completely control the fleshy wobbling, but at least you're able to reach the mall without further compromising your modesty.

It still isn't enough to deter unwanted attentions, however; as you make your way across the mall parking lot the driver of a passing pickup sounds his horn appreciatively. You practically jump out of your shoes at that sudden blast, which obviously amuses the driver and his passenger to no end.

Eventually, though, you do finally reach the mall. There's no shortage of lecherous ogling in here, either, but you don't care anymore—you're almost to the store! Almost back to normal! Throwing modesty aside, you break into a jog, shamelessly using your hands to keep your oversized bosom from escaping your top as you take the escalator two steps at a time. You're probably quite the sight, but it's worth the embarrassment because in just a few more seconds you're there.... in front of the closed store.

What?

Sore, embarrassed and out of breath, you stand there, panting helplessly in front of the darkened storefront. It's barely four o'clock, and every other store in the mall is still bustling with activity. But not Spells 'R Us. The shop is as silent as midnight, tightly locked behind slats of rolling steel.

“No...” you mutter, “They can't be closed... They can't be...”
