The Codex provides an at-a-glance guide to the various characters, settings and artifacts featured in the Adventure. Meant as an author's handbook to help keep track of additions across multiple storylines, the Codex is continually updated as new authors expand and refine the world of the Adventure. As it details the true nature of events sometimes meant to remain somewhat mysterious to readers, the Codex may contain heavy spoilers.

F.A.Q.
A collection of tidbits about the story itself. Updated as necessary.
15.title: INDEX AND STORY RECORD-KEEPING

choices: [Suggest an addition to the list here]
151.content:
"Trapped as Penelope"
After purchasing a so-called "Collar of Mind Control," you find yourself trapped in the body of your friend Penelope. Can you find a way to remove the collar and get back to normal? Can you find out what happened to the real Penelope? Can you even survive high school as a buxom nerdette?
         Start this storyline here: "Trapped as Penelope!" 

"Transformational College Experience"
While out looking for a part-time job, you've been offered a full-ride scholarship to a brand new university! All you have to do is take a short placement exam; but is this 'experimental institution' everything it seems?
         Start this storyline here: "Placement Exam: Question 1" 

"The Historian's Pen"
On a whim, you've purchased a fancy pen that turns out to have the power to re-write reality! Can you use the pen to get everything you've ever wanted, without letting the power go to your head? Or, worse, letting someone else get their hands on the pen?
         Start this storyline here: "Buying the Historian's Pen" 

"The Lust Powder at School"
After a trip to the mall, you've purchased a bottle of magical powder that promises to make you irresistibly attractive to the next person you touch! An enticing promise, but the effects of the powder aren't exactly what you anticipate...
         Start this storyline here: "Choosing a Target for the Lust Powder."
151.title: >Index of existing Storylines

choices: Please add the following character: (tell me which)
Please update the following character description (tell me how)
1521.content:
Characters

Elliot Barnes: The protagonist and player character. Elliot is 18 years old, a senior in high school, and not terribly remarkable. His good friends are Kyle, Matthew, Penelope and Kate. Physically, he is rather gangly.

Rosa: Receptionist, guide and public relations liaison for King Applied Research Center and its affiliated projects. She is always friendly and chipper, a smile never far from her warm, approachable face.

Penelope: A nerdy, shy, female friend of Elliot. She is not interested in Elliot romantically, though he for his part has something of a crush on her. She is insecure about her squeaky voice, her mousy hair, and her unusually large bosom, which she hides under baggy, shapeless sweaters as best she can.

Kate: An athletic, tomboyish friend of Elliot. She was Elliot's friend and neighbor growing up, and while they have since moved apart they still consider one another Best Friends. She has been spending less time with Elliot and the others since she started dating her first boyfriend, Marcus.

Annie Breen: A smart, geeky girl at Elliot's school. She is very pretty, but so far has avoided dating.

Jessica White: Head Cheerleader at Elliot's School. She's extremely popular, generally regarded as the prettiest girl in school, and a genuinely nice person.

Ashton: Theater star at Elliot's school. Somewhat vain and determined to become a Broadway actress.

Lizzie: Lizzie is a girl at Elliot's school with a reputation for being 'Easy.' She tends to dress provocatively.

The Wizard: (Not an original Character) The Wizard is the proprietor of the Spells R Us magic shoppe, and something of a trickster. While he never outright lies to his customers, his instructions can sometimes be vague, incomplete or misleading. He possesses mild telepathy and an eye for poetic justice. Most of the items in his shop tend to lead to TG transformation in one way or another.

Kyle: Elliot's friend. A smart guy, known to have had an obsession with UFOs a few years ago.

Matthew: Elliot's friend. Primarily occupied with getting laid, and as such easily manipulated by the fairer sex.

Marcus: Kate's boyfriend.

April Sutton: A shy, lesbian girl at Elliot's school. A petite girl, she has short black hair in pigtails and a slim but attractive figure.
1521.title: Characters

choices: Please add the following location: (please specify)
Please edit the following description (please specify)
1522.content:
West Lowery Central High: A public high school, attended by Elliot and most of his friends.

King Applied Research Center: An eccentric research laboratory in West Lowery. It's essentially of Mad-Science meets slick corporate image and organization. Sort of like Frankenstein with a defense contract. KARC dabbles in all sorts of fringe science, including teleportation, time travel, transformation and body-switching, all with a smile and promises of a brighter tomorrow. They aren't outright evil or power hungry, exactly, but they are willing to do pretty much anything they see as necessary in the name of Science! For the greater good, of course.

King University: A prototype university affiliated with King Applied Research Center. The courses tend to make extensive use of the exotic technology of their affiliate. Rather than try to integrate students into the community organically—an inefficient process at best—administrators have designed a 'perfect' campus with a 'perfect' distribution of roles and students. Applicants are thus 'Placed' into one of the pre-designed profiles, transformed as necessary to meet the creator's vision for that profile. Placement is determined by means of a multiple-choice aptitude test, and once a student is placed, discussion of any previous life is strictly forbidden. Students who fail in their studies may be placed into "remediation," during which they will swap profiles with a non-student affiliated with the college, where they will have to complete some objective to prove they are ready to re-enter the university environment.

Spells R Us: Spells R Us is a magic shoppe run by an elderly wizard. Most of the items in his shop are otherwise mundane objects, such as books, gum, clothing or what have you, that carry with them magical rules or properties. Usually, these ultimately result in transforming a guy into a girl in one way or another.
1522.title: Settings

153.content:
Q: Why is this story called the 'Gender Transformation Mega-Adventure' when most of the transformations actually apply to sex, not gender? Don't you know the difference?

A: This is an excellent point, and one I dithered over for some time. I'd have called it the 'Sex Transformation Mega-Adventure,' but that title seems to imply that the transformations relate to sexual intercourse, which for the most part they do not. Since most people do not differentiate between sex and gender anyway, I decided that the technically inaccurate 'Gender Transformation' label would be less misleading for the majority of readers.

Q: I made a mistake in my chapter! Can I edit it?

A: Of course! While technically only the owner of an Interactive Story can edit chapters, I'll be happy to introduce any corrections you submit. Just send me a message with your desired changes and the chapter you wish to change, and I'll usually have them edited into your chapter within twelve to twenty-four hours.

Q: One or more of your image links are not working! Is the picture gone forever?

A: If you are unable to view any of the images, please, please let me know. I'll fix it as soon as possible, even re-uploading the image if necessary.

Q: What is the 'Codex?'

A: The Codex is a sort of mini-encyclopedia that describes the various characters, settings, and objects within the story. As new chapters and new authors continue to develop the fictional world, the Codex is updated to include these additions.

Q: Do I need to read the Codex to understand the story?
A: Absolutely not. The Codex is simply a resource for authors, consolidating pertinent information about the story's world in one place for easy reference. While anyone is welcome to read it, the Codex may contain spoilers.

Q: Why isn't my favorite storyline listed in the Index of Existing Storylines?'

A: This may be an oversight. If you know of a well-developed storyline no listed in the index, please let me know.

Q: Why, in the "Transformative College Experience" storyline, are all the white girl profiles listed as "White Non-Hispanic?" Do you hate latinos?

A: The designation "White Non-Hispanic" is the form used on official U.S. Census surveys and statistics. Since the profiles are supposed to sound "official," I used that form. As to why they use that wording, there are actually pretty understandable reasons, but they are available elsewhere so I won't reproduce them here.
153.title: >Frequently Asked Questions

info.brief_description: You, 18-year-old Elliot Barnes, are an ordinary guy-until one day you're not a guy at all!
info.description:
The Gender Transformation Mega-Adventure

Go ahead: Add a chapter!

Information for Readers:
Thank you for choosing The Gender Transformation Mega-Adventure! If this is your first experience with this interactive, please feel free to jump right in and begin reading using the large "Click Here To Enter This Story!" link at the bottom of this page. If you're a returning reader looking for a particular plotline, just use the INDEX/STORY RECORDKEEPING page. There you will find a list of all the major adventures within the Mega-Story, complete with teasers and links to take you right into the action!

Information for Contributors:
The Gender Transformation Mega-Adventure is an open project, and your contributions are both welcome and encouraged! Whether you submit a single chapter or return frequently to develop entire plotlines, your creativity is what keeps this project from stagnation. This is particularly true now, as the story has just been opened up for submissions; if you're thinking about adding a chapter, please, take the plunge!

However, while the creativity and collaboration of so many authors are what make modern interactive stories such an exciting medium, such diversity can—if not properly managed—make maintaining a consistent level of quality difficult. In particular, contributions of different authors can be very different in style, creating a jarring experience for readers. Therefore, below you will find a list of guidelines intended to keep this story as stylistically consistent as possible. These guidelines are in no way intended to restrict the creativity of authors, and exceptions may always be made at your discretion if you feel that good storytelling demands it. That said, authors should do their best to respect the established style of the adventure when possible, as described below:


1.) Following the tradition of other game-books—including the famous Choose-Your-Own-Adventure series—The Gender Transformation Mega-Adventure is told from the second person perspective. Thus, all direct narration should refer to the protagonist, Elliot, as "You." Likewise, the options presented at the end of each chapter should represent a choice available to the protagonist. For example, "Go through the ominous-looking door" would be a valid option, while "Suddenly, your best friend arrives" would not. The former is a choice available to the protagonist, while the latter is not.

2.) The protagonist and viewpoint character is a native of the United States, and as the narration should generally use United States Customary Units (inches, pounds, degrees Fahrenheit, and so forth) when such measures are required. In general, the cultural backdrop is assumed to be American unless otherwise noted in your storyline.

3.) An overview of the currently established canon is available in the ">Codex" . While continuity between branches is not required, it is both fun and encouraged!

4.) This is the Gender Transformation Mega-Adventure. This means that, ultimately, every storyline deals with that subject at one point or another. Such transformations can—and usually do—occur in addition to other circumstances, (like time travel or reality manipulation or armies of robots or evil cults or what have you) but ultimately the theme of the story should be included. This is important because it allows readers to behave as they like without worrying about 'missing out' on the transformation even if they decide not to pull every lever that says 'WARNING: Do Not Pull.'

5.) In the narration, pronouns should refer to characters in the way the protagonist and veiwpoint character, Elliot, sees them. That is, whether a transformed character is called 'he' 'she' or 'it' in the narration is determined by how Elliot sees the individual, not necessarily their current, future or original sex.

6.) When possible, offer more than one option at the end of a chapter even if you don't intend to continue the second path. Other authors may be jumping at the bit for a chance to pursue that particular storyline!

7.) [NEW!] I hate to have to add this one, but long chains of extremely short chapters containing nothing but endless empty options will be pruned. By this, I mean those long chains of "How about [Franchise X]? Yes/no?" where the list of potential franchises goes on forever without any actual content for any of them. I really want to be as inclusive as possible, but these sequences can really hurt the quality of the story.

8.) Have fun! Really!
